org.bonitasoft.engine.platform

Interface Platform

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface Platform
extends Serializable
    Contains information about the Bonita BPM Platform.

    The platform is the base on which runs the Bonita BPM Engine. There is only one platform for a running Bonita BPM Engine.

    In order to perform actions on the platform, please, refer to the PlatformAPI

    Since:
    6.0.0
    Author:
    Matthieu Chaffotte
    See Also:
    PlatformAPI

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getCreated()
      Retrieves the timestamp at which the platform was created
      String getCreatedBy()
      Retrieves the name of the platform technical user that created the platform
      String getInitialVersion()
      Retrieves the platform initial version.
      String getPreviousVersion()
      Retrieves the platform previous version.
      String getVersion()
      Retrieves the platform version

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        String getVersion()
        Retrieves the platform version
        Returns:
        a String representing the platform version
        See Also:
        getPreviousVersion(), getInitialVersion()

      • getPreviousVersion

        String getPreviousVersion()
        Retrieves the platform previous version. This information only will be set if you have installed the Bonita BPM engine in a previous version before upgrading to a new version using the Bonita BPM Migration Tool. Otherwise, this method will return an empty string.

        For instance, if you have migrated from version 6.3.3 to version 6.3.4, getPreviousVersion will return 6.3.3 and getVersion() will return 6.3.4.

        Returns:
        a String representing the platform previous version
        See Also:
        getVersion(), getInitialVersion()

      • getInitialVersion

        String getInitialVersion()
        Retrieves the platform initial version. That is, the Bonita BPM version in which you have initially created the platform before migrating to the current version.

        For instance, if you have created your platform in the version 6.1.0 and have migrated to the version 6.3.4 using the Bonita BPM Migration Tool, getInitialVersion will return 6.1.0, getPreviousVersion() will return 6.3.3 and getVersion() will return 6.3.4.

        Returns:
        a String representing the platform initial version
        See Also:
        getVersion(), getPreviousVersion()

      • getCreated

        long getCreated()
        Retrieves the timestamp at which the platform was created
        Returns:
        a long representing the timestamp at which the platform was created

      • getCreatedBy

        String getCreatedBy()
        Retrieves the name of the platform technical user that created the platform
        Returns:
        a String representing the name of the platform technical user that created the platform
